publicwhip.spmotion: S3M-4537 Marilyn Livingstone: Apex Scotland, Fife Services—That the Parliament welcomes the opening of Apex Scotland’s new premises for Fife, based in Kirkcaldy; recognises that Apex Scotland is now regarded as the leading employment and training organisation in Scotland, specialising in work with offenders, ex-offenders and young people at risk by advising them on how legislation affects them when they are looking for work or training; commends Apex Scotland for addressing the employment needs of these groups, thereby increasing their prospects of finding employment, reducing offending and contributing to safer communities; praises the services in Fife that will provide guidance and assistance to individuals who face barriers to employment, education and training opportunities due to offending, drug, alcohol or homelessness issues; welcomes the relationships that Apex Scotland has built with a number of agencies in Fife to help tackle the problems of offending, drug use and homelessness more effectively, such as Fife Council, Scottish Enterprise Fife, Careers Scotland, Jobcentre Plus, Criminal Justice Services/Social Work Services, Adam Smith College, Carnegie College, Fife DAAT, Scottish Fife/Drugs Forum, Fife Alcohol Forum, Fife NHS Addiction Services, Fife Homelessness Forum and many local employers eager to support service users; acknowledges that Apex Scotland’s services in Fife are a welcome addition to the measures already in place to encourage people back into employment and are helping to address economic and social needs in Fife, and congratulates all those involved in helping individuals find employment and making our communities safer. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson, David Stewart, Helen Eadie, Ken Macintosh, Trish Godman, Bill Butler
S3M-4537 Apex Scotland, Fife Services (lodged on 29 June 2009) Dr Richard Simpson*
